sen.j: 鏡の宿（かがみのしゅく）は、平安時代から見える近江国蒲生郡鏡山 (滋賀県) の北（現滋賀県蒲生郡竜王町大字鏡）にある東山道の宿場（宿駅）。
sen.e: Kagami no Shuku was an inn on the Tosan-do Road, north of Mount Kagami, in Gamo Country of the Omi Province (present day Gagami, Oaza, Ryuo-cho, Gamo-gun, Shiga Prefecture) that has existed since the Heian Era.

sen.j: 早朝に平安京を出た旅人の多くが最初の宿泊地とした。
sen.e: It was the first stopping place of most of the travelers that started out from Heian-kyo (present day Kyoto) early in the morning.

sen.j: 『平治物語』で源義経が自ら元服した地として知られる。
sen.e: In the "Heiji Monogatari (Tale of the Heiji)" it is known as the place where MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune personally performed the ceremony celebrating his attainment of manhood.

sen.j: 16歳の遮那王（義経）は、稚児として預けられていた鞍馬寺を出奔した。
sen.e: At the age of 16, Rushanao (Yoshitsune) left Kurama-dera Temple, where he had been placed as a page.
Rushanao (Yoshitsune), at the age of 16, left Kurama-dera Temple, where he had been placed as a Chigo (child in a Buddhist possession).

sen.e: Rushanao (Yoshitsune), at the age of 16, left Kurama-dera Temple, where he had been placed as a Chigo (child in a Buddhist possession).

sen.j: その日の晩に鏡の宿に到着すると、夜も更けてから自分で髻を結い、懐から取り出した烏帽子をかぶって元服した。
sen.e: Arriving at the Kagami no Shuku in the evening, he waited until the fall of night before arranging his own hair and donning the eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles), thus celebrating his entrance into manhood.

sen.j: 成人した諱を付ける烏帽子親もいないので、自ら源九郎義経と名乗ったという。
sen.e: As there was no one to perform the ceremony and give him an adult name, he named himself GENKURO Yoshitsune.
